title: Watch: Jerry Nadler claims TODAY it is child abuse for not masking your 2-year-old, gets shredded by Chip Roy
description:
You won't believe this video was from TODAY and not June 2020. Even I was skeptical. Greg Price isn't known for doing clickbaity things like that. Maybe he had woken up this morning and chosen violence. I'm not one to judge.

But, no. On June 14th, 2023 -- Day 780ish to flatten the curve -- at around 1:45 PM eastern, Democrat Congressman Jerry Nadler took to the floor of Congress and said the following:

Two-year-olds should have been required to wear masks. It would be child abuse for parents not to do this. The only way to protect them against Covid was to have them wear masks. These mandates are meant to protect the public's health and safety.
Nadler: "When we have a pandemic like covid, two-year-olds should have been required to wear masks. It would be child abuse for parents not to do that." pic.twitter.com/8dcF9MJhDC
— Greg Price (@greg_price11) June 14, 2023

This wasn't during the golden days of the pandemic when fat b*tches were screaming "I hope you die" to toddlers. This wasn't December 2021 where, by that point, most people knew masks were booty but there were still some stragglers. A ranking member of the Democrat Party, close to 800 days after the pandemic began, accused parents of child abuse for not masking iup their two-year-old.

Thankfully, Rep. Chip Roy was there to barbecue him.

Rep. @chiproytx responded by ripping Nadler a new one: "My Democratic colleagues [believe] the full power of the federal government should be part of ensuring and forcing your two year old child to be masked." pic.twitter.com/eHcxMXHMUC
— Greg Price (@greg_price11) June 14, 2023

What else can you say? The videos speak for themselves. If you ever needed another excuse to render progressives powerless in this country, here ya' go!

title: Conservative shares three powerful words on how dads best protect their kids from predators: "Be A Threat"
description:
A Nick Freitas video is going viral this week. It's advice to the dads of America on protecting their children.

Freitas mentioned an interview where a convicted child predator shared what he looked for in a child. The predator said it was less what he looked for in a child than what he looked for in the parents. If the child had a father who would rightfully beat the sh*t out of him, he would pass on that child and find one who did not.

\u201cEvery parent needs to watch this.\u201d
— Catch Up (@Catch Up) 1686668385

These are your keys to victory in protecting your children:

  1. Be a threat.
  2. Be present enough in your kid's life that predators KNOW you're a threat.

Though Nick did have something else on his mind:

There's a lot of people right now that seem Hell bent to have sexual conversations with our children without our knowledge. Those are the same people telling us that the very things that make you a threat are manifestations of toxic masculinity. So maybe we shouldn't listen to those people.

He makes an excellent point. And one that really resonates for some reason this week.

I just, I don't know. I'm having a hard time putting my finger on it.

\u201c.@AsmLoriDWilson says that if your 7 year old says \u201cthey are not the same gender as they are biologically,\u201d their belief must be affirmed, because to do otherwise would be to reject your child. She says parents \u201cshould be affirming our children in every possible way.\u201d #AB957\u201d
— Laura Powell (@Laura Powell) 1679510844

I'm sure it will come to me.

It's good advice and advice I would hope most dads don't NEED to hear because they know already. Every adult your kid comes across should know you will inflict an above-average amount of harm to them if they EVERY hurt one of your kids. It is the one thing that best keeps predators away.

title: Bud Light, Target boycotts are scaring Wall Street as companies are afraid to discuss woke corporate initiatives
description:
The boycotts are working. It turns out the best way to get corporations to pull back on their pandering to radical progressives is to let them hear opposing voices that force them to choose. Go figure.

After watching Bud Light and Target lose tens of b-b-b-billions of dollars and effectively putting the BROKE in "get woke go broke," other companies are pulling back on their woke initiatives. Or, at least talking about their woke initiatives out loud. Hey, it's a start.

The Daily Mail is reporting there was a 31 percent drop in mentions of woke issues during earnings in the most recent quarter. There were almost 1,000 mentions of woke causes in earnings at the start of 1Q22. By QQ223, it's down to only 575 mentions.

Unfortunately, for now, JUST the mentions.

Although the companies appear to avoiding discussions on divisive issues as part of a larger strategy, there is little evidence to suggest that they are pulling back from actual sustainability initiatives which are still being performed in the background.

CEOs believe their company's ESG programs improve financial performance, but the way in which companies are conveying such messages is now being adjusted in an effort to avoid controversy.

Yes. They are adjusting how they convey those messages by being too embarrassed to talk about them out loud. Out of fear of losing tens of b-b-b-billions of dollars too. Yet, pandering to the most radical of the radical left still "improves financial performance?"

I am still calling it a win in a battle of a much larger war.

We saw it right after the Bud Light fiasco with Coca-Cola, where the board rejected an ESG proposal to target/attack pro-life states. Coca-Cola is a company that a few short years ago was shaming employees for being white. And this was when Bud Light's financial losses were only in the single-digit billions. title: Man shares terrifying warning of what happened to his entire Amazon smart home when they accused him of a racial slur
description:
The funny thing is I was debating about learning how to use my Roomba. After reading this story, all Alexa is getting is deez nuts. A man shared his story of how his Amazon smart home was shut down because an Amazon driver thought he heard a racial slur. The man lost all access to his Amazon smart products pending an investigation.

As far as context "gotta hear both sides" malarky, this is one man's claim. However, the man shared his videos and information with YouTuber Louis Rossmann. He didn't want to dox himself in his Medium post, which makes sense considering what he went through.

The man has a smart home. His primary means of interfacing with all the devices and automations is through Amazon Echo devices. One day his devices went unresponsive. And when he asked Alexa what was wrong, she said "Nothing."

The [Amazon] representative told me I should have received an email, which I indeed found in my inbox. It was from an executive at Amazon. As I dialed the number provided in the email, I half-wondered if Amazon was experiencing some issues and I was unwittingly falling into a scam.
When I connected with the executive, they asked if I knew why my account had been locked. When I answered I was unsure, their tone turned somewhat accusatory. I was told that the driver who had delivered my package reported receiving racist remarks from my “Ring doorbell.”

Here's the rub... no one was home at the time. And it wasn't a Ring doorbell, it was a different brand. That doorbell's automated response when the Amazon driver dropped off packages was “Excuse me, can I help you?” The driver, who was wearing headphones, claimed he heard something else. He even provided video evidence of this, but Amazon did not care.

The timing couldn’t have been worse: the onset of Labor Day weekend was approaching, and I was keen to resolve the issue before the long weekend. However, despite numerous calls and emails, it wasn’t until Friday afternoon that I received confirmation that the investigation had started. I was told to expect a response within two business days, meaning not until Tuesday of the following week at the earliest.

His account was finally unlocked the next Wednesday.

We have seen other examples of this: a "smart" thermostat shutting a man out of lowering his air conditioning (for schlimate change reasons), Tesla sending GOVERNMENT MESSAGES to all cars about "the strong suggestion" to conserve electricity, etc. This example is the most extreme. And while it would have still been bullsh*t even had the man said a mean word to the driver, the fact the man wasn't even home makes it worse.

Today it's a driver claiming to have heard something he didn't hear. What when it's a customer who expressed an opinion online that corporate Amazon employees don't like? As it is, you don't even have to write a "problematic" post yourself to get canceled these days. You only need to like someone else's.

This is the world progressives want for you. It's why their vision of a cashless society or "owning nothing and liking it" is terrifying. They WANT to be able to shut you down on a whim. Today it's someone claiming you said a bad word (that you weren't home to say). Tomorrow it will be a social media post. Or spreading what others claim is "misinformation."

With a snap of the fingers, this man lost the use of the items HE OWNS. All over a misunderstanding. You can just as easily be locked out of your "smart" home for the same.

Pay attention, America.
